hints.text: For part of the year, faces disappear while the city fills up.
hints.explanationText: During Venice's annual Carnival, many people wear traditional Venetian masks, hiding their faces. At the same time, the city fills with visitors from around the world.

hints.text: You can cross the entire city without ever seeing a car.
hints.explanationText: Venice has no roads for cars. Movement happens on foot or by boat, making it possible to walk across the city without encountering any automobiles.

hints.text: Here, streets are wet and parking is mostly floating.
hints.explanationText: Canals function as streets, and boats serve as the primary vehicles.

hints.text: This city was built across more than a hundred small islands.
hints.explanationText: Venice is spread over 100+ islands connected by bridges.

hints.text: I lie in a lagoon on the Adriatic Sea, in northeastern Italy.
hints.explanationText: This gives Venice's unique geographic setting.

solutionExplanation: The hints describe Venice, a car-free city defined by canals, bridges, Carnival traditions, and its unique location on a lagoon in northeastern Italy.
